intro: Centaurium erythraea var. masclansii, commonly known as the red centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is native to Europe and western Asia. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This variant is often found in meadows and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
